instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
These three keys are not working. Keyboard connector looks good. PP3V42 is present. When keys are pressed, they go high to 3.42V.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: Check around <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
What should I be looking there exactly?

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 3.45V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.45V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: For example, when I press Option key, <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> pin 56 goes high to 3.42V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
The 3 keys pass through <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>, before <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
You cannot make SMC reset, or none of them works independent?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
Yes, the keys pass through <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> before reaching <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>. 
You mean PRAM reset? I did SMC by removing battery and power and holding power button for 10 seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
The combination of these 3 keys makes SMC manual reset.
My question, you cannot do that, or none of the keys works independently?
What is your ptoblem exactly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: I cannot do that and none of the keys work independently.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
Right Alt, Option keys work?
The rest of keyboard is all OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: Correct. They both work and rest of the keyboard works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: Then change <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: Even though it has correct values as well as when keys are pressed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: I've changed <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>, no luck. Even reflowed the old one with flux in case it had some crap under it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
I've also changed <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and J5713, no luck. 

I understand if one of those three keys are not working, meaning bad trace or something else, but all three of them not working, even after changing the three components mentioned. Plus, signals are present and I tested a good known keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: Post voltage at <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
Sorry, need <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> voltages.
However, we take a look to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> values...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: So what would be my next step here please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5750</CHIP> is the common thing on these 3 keys.
If none of them works, and traces to/from <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> are surely good, this is a f***g poltergeist...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message: I donâ€™t see any other logic too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift, control, option not working
threads.message:
You probably messed something to check in that area.
J5713 - <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> - <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
Check again all traces and post <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> voltages...
